etymology.interpretation: Depicts a bundle of silk threads tied in the middle, with strands hanging above and below. The stylized sketch highlights twisted filaments, which later served as the standard radical for thread- and textile-related characters.
etymology.simplification: In Simplified Chinese the silk radical was streamlined to 纟 to reduce strokes and speed writing; 糸 is rarely used independently, but 纟 replaces it as a left-side component.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢丝绸(我喜歡絲綢)。
这件衣服是用蚕丝做的(這件衣服是用蠶絲做的)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn yīfu shì yòng cánsī zuò de.
examples.english: This piece of clothing is made from silkworm silk.
